[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::new()] [Key reuse] Is there validation preventing the same EventKey from being used in multiple EventHandles, which could cause event stream conflicts and data corruption in storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::new()] [Count overflow initialization] Can an attacker initialize EventHandle with count close to u64::MAX to cause immediate overflow on the next event emission, potentially crashing the VM or causing state inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::new()] [Uninitialized handles] Can EventHandles be created without proper initialization in Move code, leading to handles with default/zero values that conflict with actual event streams? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::key()] [Reference lifetime] Does returning a reference to EventKey create lifetime issues where the reference outlives the EventHandle, potentially causing use-after-free bugs in Rust code? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::key()] [Immutability bypass] Can the returned reference be unsafely cast to mutable, allowing modification of the EventKey after EventHandle creation and breaking immutability guarantees? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count()] [Race condition] Can concurrent reads of count() in multi-threaded contexts return stale or inconsistent values during event emission, causing event numbering conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count()] [Count rollback] If a transaction aborts after reading count(), can the count value be rolled back incorrectly leading to duplicate event sequence numbers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count()] [Off-by-one] Does count represent events emitted or the next sequence number, and can confusion about this semantic lead to off-by-one errors in event stream processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count_mut()] [Unchecked increment] When incrementing the count through the mutable reference, is there overflow checking, or can count wrap from u64::MAX to 0 causing duplicate event sequence numbers and replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count_mut()] [Transaction atomicity] If a transaction increments count via count_mut() but then aborts, is the increment properly rolled back, or can failed transactions leave the counter in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/event.rs] [Function: EventHandle::count_mut()] [Unauthorized mutation] Can Move code from untrusted modules gain mutable access to EventHandle counters they don't own, allowing them to manipulate event sequences of other accounts? (Critical)
